org.apache.felix.ipojo.util
Class Tracker.Tracked

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.HashMap
          org.apache.felix.ipojo.util.Tracker.Tracked
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, java.util.Map, org.osgi.framework.ServiceListener
Enclosing class:
Tracker
 class Tracker.Tracked
extends java.util.HashMap
implements org.osgi.framework.ServiceListener

Inner class to track services. If a Tracker object is reused (closed then reopened), then a new Tracked object is used. This class is a hashtable mapping ServiceReference object -> customized Object. This class is the ServiceListener object for the tracker. This class is used to synchronize access to the tracked services. This is not a public class. It is only for use by the implementation of the Tracker class.

serialVersionUID

See Also:
Constant Field Values

m_adding

private java.util.List m_adding
The list of ServiceReferences in the process of being added. This is used to deal with nesting of ServiceEvents. Since ServiceEvents are synchronously delivered, ServiceEvents can be nested. For example, when processing the adding of a service and the customizer causes the service to be unregistered, notification to the nested call to untrack that the service was unregistered can be made to the track method. Since the ArrayList implementation is not synchronized, all access to this list must be protected by the same synchronized object for thread safety.

m_closed

private volatile boolean m_closed
true if the tracked object is closed. This field is volatile because it is set by one thread and read by another.

m_initial

private java.util.List m_initial
The Initial list of ServiceReferences for the tracker. This is used to correctly process the initial services which could become unregistered before they are tracked. This is necessary since the initial set of tracked services are not "announced" by ServiceEvents and therefore the ServiceEvent for unregistration could be delivered before we track the service. A service must not be in both the initial and adding lists at the same time. A service must be moved from the initial list to the adding list "atomically" before we begin tracking it. Since the LinkedList implementation is not synchronized, all access to this list must be protected by the same synchronized object for thread safety.

Tracker.Tracked

protected Tracker.Tracked()
Tracked constructor.

Method Detail

setInitialServices

protected void setInitialServices(org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference[] references)
Sets initial list of services into tracker before ServiceEvents begin to be received. This method must be called from Tracker.open while synchronized on this object in the same synchronized block as the addServiceListener call.

Parameters:
references - The initial list of services to be tracked.

trackInitialServices

protected void trackInitialServices()
Tracks the initial list of services. This is called after ServiceEvents can begin to be received. This method must be called from Tracker.open while not synchronized on this object after the addServiceListener call.

close

protected void close()
Called by the owning Tracker object when it is closed.

serviceChanged

public void serviceChanged(org.osgi.framework.ServiceEvent event)
ServiceListener method for the Tracker class. This method must NOT be synchronized to avoid deadlock potential.

Specified by:
serviceChanged in interface org.osgi.framework.ServiceListener
Parameters:
event - the ServiceEvent object from the framework.

track

protected void track(org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference reference)
Begins to track the referenced service.

Parameters:
reference - the Reference to a service to be tracked.

trackAdding

private void trackAdding(org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference reference)
Common logic to add a service to the tracker used by track and trackInitialServices. The specified reference must have been placed in the adding list before calling this method.

Parameters:
reference - the Reference to a service to be tracked.

untrack

protected void untrack(org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference reference)
Discontinues tracking the referenced service.

Parameters:
reference - the Reference to the tracked service.

modified

void modified()
Called by the Tracked object whenever the set of tracked services is modified. Increments the tracking count and clears the cache. This method must not be synchronized since it is called by Tracked while Tracked is synchronized. We don't want synchronization interactions between the ServiceListener thread and the user thread.
